WorkItem.ClosedComment: Closed, a new release has already been posted with a fix
WorkItem.Description:
Rawr3 throws an Invalid Cross Thread Access error when trying to import character from Armory.
 
Steps to Reproduce:
Launch Rawr3 from ElitistJerks.com
File > Load From Armory
Type in Realm and Character
Click the "OK" button
 Rawr goes through process of retrieving information, then throws "[InvalidCrossThreadAccess]" error within the loading bar.
 
Additional Information:
Rawr v3 b5 on elitistjerks.com
Have tested on Mac OS X 10.5.8 and Mac OS X 10.6.2 (two separate computers). Seemingly works fine on my Windows XP virtual machine.
Using Silverlight v3.0.50106.0
See http://cld.ly/a11raf for screenshot of error text

Comments.Message: Additionally, I've tried it in Safari, Chrome, and Firefox, with the same results as stated above.

Ah hah. You have an empty item cache. Use Options > Reset All Caches.

That can happen if you close the window while it's in the middle of launching the first time.
Ah, that may have been it. On first loading Rawr, on both machines, I was prompted to upgrade Silverlight, thus interrupting it.
You may want to tell people about this. It was definitely the problem for me, too. I accidentally clicked "no" when it asked me to increase the space available, thus interrupting rawr's first load.

I'm having the exact same problem.  I'm using Mac OS X 10.5.8 and the same version of Silverlight as the original poster as well.
I've tried it in Firefox and Safari, reset all caches in both, and it still gives the same error.
This issue is potentially fixed for next release.
